basic_steps: Roll a d20 and identify the modifiers, bonuses, and penalties that apply.
Compare the result to the difficulty class (DC).
Determine the degree of success and the effect.

entries.name: Blinded
entries.summary: You’re unable to see.

entries.name: Broken
entries.summary: This item can’t be used for its normal function until repaired.

entries.name: Clumsy
entries.summary: You can’t move as easily or gracefully as usual.

entries.name: Concealed
entries.summary: Fog or similar obscuration makes you difficult to see and target.

entries.name: Confused
entries.summary: You attack indiscriminately.

entries.name: Controlled
entries.summary: Another creature determines your actions.

entries.name: Dazzled
entries.summary: Everything is concealed to you.

entries.name: Deafened
entries.summary: You’re unable to hear.

entries.name: Doomed
entries.summary: With your soul in peril, you are now closer to death.

entries.name: Drained
entries.summary: Blood loss or something similar has leached your vitality.

entries.name: Dying
entries.summary: You’re slipping closer to death.

entries.name: Encumbered
entries.summary: You’re carrying more weight than you can manage.

entries.name: Enfeebled
entries.summary: Your strength has been sapped away.

entries.name: Fascinated
entries.summary: You are compelled to focus your attention on something.

entries.name: Fatigued
entries.summary: Your defenses are lower and you can’t focus while exploring.

entries.name: Flat-Footed
entries.summary: You’re unable to defend yourself to your full capability.

entries.name: Fleeing
entries.summary: You must run away.

entries.name: Friendly
entries.summary: An NPC with this condition has a good attitude toward you.

entries.name: Frightened
entries.summary: Fear makes you less capable of attacking and defending.

entries.name: Grabbed
entries.summary: A creature, object, or magic holds you in place.

entries.name: Helpful
entries.summary: An NPC with this condition wants to assist you.

entries.name: Hidden
entries.summary: A creature you’re hidden from knows your location but can’t see you.

entries.name: Hostile
entries.summary: An NPC with this condition wants to harm you.

entries.name: Immobilized
entries.summary: You can’t move.

entries.name: Indifferent
entries.summary: An NPC with this condition doesn’t have a strong opinion about you.

entries.name: Invisible
entries.summary: Creatures can’t see you.

entries.name: Observed
entries.summary: You’re in plain view.

entries.name: Paralyzed
entries.summary: You body is frozen in place.

entries.name: Persistent Damage
entries.summary: You keep taking damage every round.

entries.name: Petrified
entries.summary: You’ve been turned to stone.

entries.name: Prone
entries.summary: You’re lying on the ground and easier to attack.

entries.name: Quickened
entries.summary: You get an extra action each turn.

entries.name: Restrained
entries.summary: You’re tied up and can’t move, or a grappling creature has you pinned.

entries.name: Sickened
entries.summary: You’re sick to your stomach.

entries.name: Slowed
entries.summary: You lose actions each turn.

entries.name: Stunned
entries.summary: You can’t use actions.

entries.name: Stupefied
entries.summary: Your can’t access your full mental faculties, and you have trouble casting spells.

entries.name: Unconscious
entries.summary: You’re asleep or knocked out.

entries.name: Undetected
entries.summary: A creature you’re undetected by doesn’t know where you are.

entries.name: Unfriendly
entries.summary: An NPC with this condition doesn’t like you.

entries.name: Unnoticed
entries.summary: A creature is entirely unaware you’re present.

entries.name: Wounded
entries.summary: You’ve been brought back from the brink of death but haven’t fully recovered.

entries.name: HIDDEN PIT

detection.raw: DC 18 (or 0 if the trapdoor is disabled or broken)

disable.raw: Thievery DC 12 to remove the trapdoor

defenses.raw: 10; Fort +1, Ref +1 Trapdoor Hardness 3, Trapdoor HP 12 (BT 6); Immunities critical hits, object immunities, precision damage

trigger_actions.raw: Pitfall [reaction] Trigger A creature walks onto the trapdoor. Effect The triggering creature falls in and takes falling damage (typically 10 bludgeoning damage). That creature can use the Grab an Edge reaction to avoid falling.
trigger_actions.name: Pitfall
trigger_actions.trigger: A creature walks onto the trapdoor.
trigger_actions.effect: The triggering creature falls in and takes falling damage (typically 10 bludgeoning damage). That creature can use the Grab an Edge reaction to avoid falling.

entries.reset: Creatures can still fall into the trap, but the trapdoor must be reset manually for the trap to become hidden again.

trigger_actions.trigger: A creature tries to unlock or Pick the Lock.
trigger_actions.effect: A spine extends to attack the triggering creature.

disable.raw: Thievery DC 15 (trained) on the floor panels before the slab falls

defenses.raw: 16; Fort +10, Ref +2 5, HP 20 (BT 10); Immunities critical hits, object immunities, precision damage

trigger_actions.raw: Slam Shut [reaction] Trigger Pressure is placed on any floor tile. Effect The door falls, closing off the hallway. The stone slab deals 3d8 bludgeoning damage to anyone beneath or adjacent to the slab when it drops and pushes them out of its space in a random direction. A creature that succeeds at a DC 17 Reflex save takes no damage and rolls out of the way in a random direction. On a critical success, they can choose the direction. Lifting the fallen slab requires a successful DC 25 Athletics check. Hitting the floor panels triggers the trap. The slab uses the same AC and saves as the trap, but it has Hardness 12, HP 48 (BT 24).

Lifting the fallen slab requires a successful DC 25 Athletics check. Hitting the floor panels triggers the trap. The slab uses the same AC and saves as the trap, but it has Hardness 12, HP 48 (BT 24).

disable.raw: Thievery DC 26 (expert) to disable the hammer that strikes the percussion cap

defenses.raw: 24; Fort +0, Ref +0 0, HP 1; Immunities critical hits, object immunities, precision damage

trigger_actions.raw: Powder Burst [reaction] (mental, poison); Trigger The latch is opened or the tube is broken. Effect The tube explodes, spraying hallucinogenic powder in a 30-foot cone. Any creature in the cone must succeed at a DC 24 Will save or be confused for 1 round and take a –2 status penalty to Perception checks and saves against mental effects for 1d4 hours. On a critical failure, the penalty is instead –4.

entries.name: PHARAOH’S WARD

disable.raw: Thievery DC 27 (master) to painstakingly remove the lintel without triggering the magic, or dispel magic (4th level; counteract DC 25) to counteract the rune

trigger_actions.raw: Curse the Intruders [reaction] (curse, divine, necromancy); Trigger The seal on the tomb is broken from the outside. Effect Each living creature within 60 feet must succeed at a DC 23 Will save or be subjected to the pharaoh’s curse. A cursed creature takes a –2 status penalty to Fortitude saves, and any natural or magical healing it receives is halved. The curse remains until removed by remove curse or similar magic.
trigger_actions.name: Curse the Intruders
trigger_actions.trigger: The seal on the tomb is broken from the outside.
trigger_actions.effect: Each living creature within 60 feet must succeed at a DC 23 Will save or be subjected to the pharaoh’s curse. A cursed creature takes a –2 status penalty to Fortitude saves, and any natural or magical healing it receives is halved. The curse remains until removed by remove curse or similar magic.

entries.reset: The trap resets when the door is shut.

disable.raw: Survival DC 26 (expert) to remove the mold without triggering the spores

defenses.raw: 27; Fort +17, Ref +13 HP 70; Immunities critical hits, object immunities, precision damage

trigger_actions.raw: Spore Explosion [reaction] Trigger A creature moves into the mold’s space or damages the mold. The mold can’t use this reaction if it’s in direct sunlight or if the damage was fire damage. Effect The triggering creature and all creatures within 10 feet are exposed to yellow mold spores. Yellow Mold Spores (inhaled, poison) Any drained condition from the spores persists after the poison’s duration ends; Saving Throw DC 26 Fortitude; Maximum Duration 6 rounds; Stage 1 1d8 poison damage and drained 1 (1 round); Stage 2 2d8 poison damage and drained 2 (1 round); Stage 3 3d8 poison damage and drained 3 (1 round)

Yellow Mold Spores (inhaled, poison) Any drained condition from the spores persists after the poison’s duration ends; Saving Throw DC 26 Fortitude; Maximum Duration 6 rounds; Stage 1 1d8 poison damage and drained 1 (1 round); Stage 2 2d8 poison damage and drained 2 (1 round); Stage 3 3d8 poison damage and drained 3 (1 round)

entries.name: BOTTOMLESS PIT

detection.raw: DC 30 (or 0 if the trapdoor is disabled or broken) or detect magic

disable.raw: Thievery DC 28 (trained) to remove the trapdoor

defenses.raw: 28; Fort +12, Ref +12 Trapdoor Hardness 9, Trapdoor HP 36 (BT 18); Immunities critical hits, object immunities, precision damage

trigger_actions.raw: Infinite Pitfall [reaction] Trigger A creature walks onto the trapdoor. Effect The triggering creature falls in and continues to fall, potentially forever. That creature can try to Grab an Edge to avoid falling (page 472). The DC to Climb the walls or Grab an Edge is 26. The pit contains many handholds, so the falling creature can try to Grab an Edge again every 6 seconds. If the creature succeeds, it can start to Climb out from that point (though it might be a very long climb, depending on how far the creature fell). Since the creature falls endlessly, it can rest and even prepare spells while falling, though items dropped while falling are usually lost forever.
trigger_actions.name: Infinite Pitfall
trigger_actions.trigger: A creature walks onto the trapdoor.
trigger_actions.effect: The triggering creature falls in and continues to fall, potentially forever. That creature can try to Grab an Edge to avoid falling (page 472). The DC to Climb the walls or Grab an Edge is 26. The pit contains many handholds, so the falling creature can try to Grab an Edge again every 6 seconds. If the creature succeeds, it can start to Climb out from that point (though it might be a very long climb, depending on how far the creature fell). Since the creature falls endlessly, it can rest and even prepare spells while falling, though items dropped while falling are usually lost forever.

entries.reset: The trap still causes creatures to fall forever if they fall in, but the trapdoor must be reset manually for the trap to become hidden again.

raw.stealth: DC 30 (or 0 if the trapdoor is disabled or broken) or detect magic
raw.disable: Thievery DC 28 (trained) to remove the trapdoor
raw.ac_and_saves: 28; Fort +12, Ref +12 Trapdoor Hardness 9, Trapdoor HP 36 (BT 18); Immunities critical hits, object immunities, precision damage

That creature can try to Grab an Edge to avoid falling (page 472). The DC to Climb the walls or Grab an Edge is 26. The pit contains many handholds, so the falling creature can try to Grab an Edge again every 6 seconds. If the creature succeeds, it can start to Climb out from that point (though it might be a very long climb, depending on how far the creature fell). Since the creature falls endlessly, it can rest and even prepare spells while falling, though items dropped while falling are usually lost forever.

disable.raw: Religion DC 29 (master) to exorcise the spirit or Diplomacy DC 31 (expert) to talk it down

trigger_actions.raw: Quietus [reaction] (death, emotion, fear, illusion, mental, occult); Trigger A creature moves within 10 feet of the haunted object. Effect The haunt takes control of the triggering creature, forcing it to attack itself. The creature must attempt a DC 29 Will save. Critical Success The target is unaffected. Success The target makes a Strike against itself and automatically hits; the target also becomes frightened 1. Failure The target makes a Strike against itself and automatically scores a critical hit; the target also becomes frightened 2. Critical Failure The target attempts a Fortitude save. If the 524 target succeeds, it is subject to the effects of a failure instead. If the target fails, it is reduced to 0 Hit Points and dies.

Success The target makes a Strike against itself and automatically hits; the target also becomes frightened 1. Failure The target makes a Strike against itself and automatically scores a critical hit; the target also becomes frightened 2. Critical Failure The target attempts a Fortitude save. If the 524 target succeeds, it is subject to the effects of a failure instead. If the target fails, it is reduced to 0 Hit Points and dies.

entries.name: HAMMER OF FORBIDDANCE

disable.raw: Thievery DC 28 (expert) once on the hammer itself and once on its joint to prevent the hammer from swinging

defenses.raw: 32; Fort +24, Ref +15 Hammer Hardness 22, Hammer HP 88 (BT 44); Joint Hardness 16, Joint HP 64 (BT 32); Immunities critical hits, object immunities, precision damage

trigger_actions.raw: Forbid Entry [reaction] (abjuration, attack, divine); Trigger A creature attempts to enter through the entrance. Effect The hammer swings down, making an attack against the triggering creature.
trigger_actions.name: Forbid Entry
trigger_actions.trigger: A creature attempts to enter through the entrance.
trigger_actions.effect: The hammer swings down, making an attack against the triggering creature.

strikes.raw: Melee hammer +28, Damage 6d8+20 bludgeoning plus the target is knocked back 10 feet and must succeed at a DC 30 Will save or be unable to enter the edifice through any entrance for 24 hours (on a critical hit, the target automatically fails the Will save); no multiple attack penalty

strikes.damage: 6d8+20 bludgeoning plus the target is knocked back 10 feet and must succeed at a DC 30 Will save or be unable to enter the edifice through any entrance for 24 hours (on a critical hit, the target automatically fails the Will save)

entries.reset: The trap resets over the course of the round, and is ready to swing again 1 round later.

disable.raw: Thievery DC 33 (master) to assemble a rift seal using objects strongly grounded to your plane, or dispel magic (7th level; counteract DC 31) to counteract the rift

trigger_actions.raw: Into the Great Beyond [reaction] (conjuration, occult, teleportation); Trigger A creature moves within 10 feet of the rift. Effect The triggering creature and all creatures within 30 feet of the rift are drawn into another plane. Each creature can attempt a DC 33 Reflex save to avoid this fate.
trigger_actions.name: Into the Great Beyond
trigger_actions.trigger: A creature moves within 10 feet of the rift.
trigger_actions.effect: The triggering creature and all creatures within 30 feet of the rift are drawn into another plane. Each creature can attempt a DC 33 Reflex save to avoid this fate.

Effect The triggering creature and all creatures within 30 feet of the rift are drawn into another plane. Each creature can attempt a DC 33 Reflex save to avoid this fate.

disable.raw: Thievery DC 38 (legendary) to rapidly disassemble the spell’s myriad components in a single blink of an eye; or dispel magic (9th level; counteract DC 36) to counteract the trap before it triggers or to counteract the effect on one creature after the trap is triggered

trigger_actions.raw: Adrift in Time [reaction] (occult, transmutation); Trigger A creature touches the warded object or area. Effect The triggering creature and all creatures within 30 feet are trapped in a disrupted time flow (DC 38 Fortitude negates). The creatures’ minds move so quickly that each round seems to last a century, but their bodies and magical energies move so slowly that they can’t use any actions except Recall Knowledge. An affected creature must attempt a DC 36 Will saving throw against a warp mind spell immediately and again for every minute of real time that passes while the creature is trapped in the frozen moment. This effect has an unlimited duration but can be counteracted.

trigger_actions.trigger: A creature touches the warded object or area.

This effect has an unlimited duration but can be counteracted.

This effect has an unlimited duration but can be counteracted.

entries.name: VORPAL EXECUTIONER

disable.raw: Thievery DC 41 (expert) at four different junctions to jam all the saw blade’s possible paths, preventing it from traveling through the room

defenses.raw: 43; Fort +32, Ref +32 30; HP 120 (BT 60) per junction; Immunities critical hits, object immunities, precision damage

trigger_actions.raw: Total Decapitation [reaction] (attack, death); Trigger A creature attempts to exit the room. Effect The saw blade travels along its path, making one Strike against each creature in the room, twisting and varying its height for a maximum chance of beheading its targets.
trigger_actions.name: Total Decapitation
trigger_actions.trigger: A creature attempts to exit the room.
trigger_actions.effect: The saw blade travels along its path, making one Strike against each creature in the room, twisting and varying its height for a maximum chance of beheading its targets.

strikes.raw: Melee saw blade +40 (deadly d12), Damage 6d12+25 slashing plus decapitation; no multiple attack penalty Decapitation On a critical hit, a target must succeed at a DC 39 Fortitude save or be decapitated, dying instantly unless it can survive without a head.
strikes.name: saw blade
strikes.notes: no multiple attack penalty Decapitation On a critical hit, a target must succeed at a DC 39 Fortitude save or be decapitated, dying instantly unless it can survive without a head.

entries.reset: The trap resets over the course of the round and can be triggered again 1 round later.

disable.raw: Thievery DC 46 (legendary) to take apart the spell one tiny piece at a time, with eyes closed, while recalling every vivid life memory in order, starting from the earliest memory

trigger_actions.raw: In the Beginning [reaction] (divine, transmutation); Trigger A creature tries to steal the object or intrude upon the location. If someone uses a proxy or dupe for the theft or intrusion, the 525 10 trap unerringly targets the true perpetrator or perpetrators at any distance—even across planes. Effect The triggering creature and up to five coconspirators instantly revert to infants, losing all memories, class abilities, and other skills acquired during their lives (DC 44 Fortitude negates). Reversing this effect is nearly impossible, requiring powerful magic such as wish.

Reversing this effect is nearly impossible, requiring powerful magic such as wish.

disable.raw: Thievery DC 48 (legendary) to imbue thieves’ tools with aspects representing Asmodeus and Sarenrae and use them to drain away the orb’s power over 10 minutes; the character attempting this check takes 5 fire damage each round until the orb is depleted

trigger_actions.raw: Burn It All [reaction] (death, divine, evocation, fire); Trigger A special condition set by the trap’s creator occurs; this is typically the event of their death. Effect Fire rains from the sky in a 100-mile radius, dealing 10d6 fire damage to creatures and objects in the area. Each creature or object can attempt a DC 46 basic Reflex save. Any creature reduced to 0 Hit Points by this damage dies instantly. This is not enough damage to completely burn away a forest or level an entire mountain or city, but it typically kills most creatures in the area.

entries.name: SUMMONING RUNE

disable.raw: Acrobatics DC 15 to approach without triggering the trap followed by Thievery DC 17 (trained) to erase the rune, or dispel magic (1st level; counteract DC 15) to counteract the rune

trigger_actions.raw: Summon Monster [reaction] (arcane, conjuration, summon; Trigger A creature enters the cloud of magical sensors. Effect This trap summons a specific level 1 creature, determined when the trap is created. The creature rolls initiative and remains for 2d6 rounds, after which the spell ends and the creature disappears. The creature also disappears if someone disables the trap before the duration expires. The summoned creature can use 3 actions each round and can use reactions, unlike most summoned creatures.
trigger_actions.name: Summon Monster
trigger_actions.trigger: A creature enters the cloud of magical sensors.
trigger_actions.effect: This trap summons a specific level 1 creature, determined when the trap is created. The creature rolls initiative and remains for 2d6 rounds, after which the spell ends and the creature disappears. The creature also disappears if someone disables the trap before the duration expires. The summoned creature can use 3 actions each round and can use reactions, unlike most summoned creatures.

entries.reset: The trap resets each day at dawn.

entries.name: DROWNING PIT

detection.raw: +10 (trained); DC 22 (expert) to notice the water spouts once the pit opens

disable.raw: Thievery DC 18 (trained) to seal each water spout, Thievery DC 22 (trained) to open the trapdoor, or Athletics DC 22 to Force Open the trapdoor

defenses.raw: 19; Fort +8, Ref +5 Trapdoor Hardness 15, Trapdoor HP 60 (BT 30); Spout 8, Spout HP 32 (BT 16); Immunities critical hits, object immunities, precision damage

trigger_actions.raw: Pitfall [reaction] Trigger A creature walks onto the trapdoor. Effect The triggering creature falls in and takes damage from the fall, reduced by 5 feet for falling into the water (typically 12 bludgeoning damage). A creature can Grab an Edge to avoid falling (page 472). The trapdoor then slams shut, and the hazard rolls initiative.
trigger_actions.name: Pitfall
trigger_actions.trigger: A creature walks onto the trapdoor.
trigger_actions.effect: The triggering creature falls in and takes damage from the fall, reduced by 5 feet for falling into the water (typically 12 bludgeoning damage). A creature can Grab an Edge to avoid falling (page 472). The trapdoor then slams shut, and the hazard rolls initiative.

routine.raw: (4 actions) The trap loses 1 action each turn for each disabled water spout. On each of the trap’s actions, a spout pours water, increasing the depth of the water by 5 feet. Once the pit is full of water, the pit stops using actions, but creatures in the pit begin drowning (page 478).
routine.text: The trap loses 1 action each turn for each disabled water spout. On each of the trap’s actions, a spout pours water, increasing the depth of the water by 5 feet. Once the pit is full of water, the pit stops using actions, but creatures in the pit begin drowning (page 478).

entries.reset: The trap can be reset if the door is manually reengaged and the water tanks refilled; it can be reset without draining the pit, but doing so renders it less effective.

detection.raw: +12 (trained) (or –10 and no minimum proficiency if the surface is disturbed)

disable.raw: Survival DC 18 (trained) to disturb the surface

trigger_actions.raw: Submerge [free-action] Trigger A Huge or smaller creature walks onto the quicksand. Effect The triggering creature sinks into the quicksand up to its waist. The quicksand rolls initiative if it hasn’t already.

trigger_actions.trigger: A Huge or smaller creature walks onto the quicksand.
trigger_actions.effect: The triggering creature sinks into the quicksand up to its waist. The quicksand rolls initiative if it hasn’t already.

routine.raw: (1 action) On its initiative, the quicksand pulls down each creature within it. A creature that was submerged up to its waist becomes submerged up to its neck, and a creature

entries.name: SPINNING BLADE PILLAR

detection.raw: +11 (trained) or DC 26 (expert) to notice the control panel

disable.raw: Thievery DC 21 (trained) twice on the pillar, or Thievery DC 19 (expert) once on the control panel deactivates the whole trap. Breaking the control panel prevents anyone from disabling the trap using the control panel and prevents the trap from deactivating automatically (see Reset below).

defenses.raw: 21; Fort +10, Ref +12 Pillar Hardness 12, Pillar HP 48 (BT 24); Panel Hardness 5, Panel HP 20 (BT 10); Immunities critical hits, object immunities, precision damage

trigger_actions.raw: Rising Pillar [reaction] (attack); Trigger A creature steps on one of the trapped floor tiles. Effect The trap pops up in a grid intersection and makes a spinning blade attack against one adjacent creature (if any), then rolls initiative.
trigger_actions.name: Rising Pillar
trigger_actions.trigger: A creature steps on one of the trapped floor tiles.
trigger_actions.effect: The trap pops up in a grid intersection and makes a spinning blade attack against one adjacent creature (if any), then rolls initiative.

routine.raw: (3 actions) The trap uses its first action to make a spinning blade Strike against each adjacent creature, its second action to move straight in a random direction (roll 1d4 to determine the direction), and its third action to make a spinning blade Strike against each adjacent creature. This trap doesn’t take a multiple attack penalty. Speed 10 feet
routine.text: The trap uses its first action to make a spinning blade Strike against each adjacent creature, its second action to move straight in a random direction (roll 1d4 to determine the direction), and its third action to make a spinning blade Strike against each adjacent creature. This trap doesn’t take a multiple attack penalty. Speed 10 feet

entries.reset: The trap deactivates and resets after 1 minute.

entries.name: WHEEL OF MISERY

detection.raw: +16 (expert) to detect the magical sensor; noticing the wheel has a DC of 0

disable.raw: Thievery DC 26 (expert) on the wheel to stop it from spinning, Thievery DC 22 (master) to erase each rune, or dispel magic (4th level; counteract DC 22) to counteract each rune

defenses.raw: 24; Fort +15, Ref +13 14, HP 56 (BT 28); Immunities critical hits, object immunities, precision damage

trigger_actions.raw: Wheel Spin [reaction] Trigger A creature enters the sensor’s detection area. Effect The wheel begins to spin and rolls initiative.
trigger_actions.name: Wheel Spin
trigger_actions.trigger: A creature enters the sensor’s detection area.
trigger_actions.effect: The wheel begins to spin and rolls initiative.

routine.raw: (2 actions) On its initiative, the trap uses its first action to spin, then stops. Roll 1d6 to determine which segment is topmost when the wheel stops spinning. The wheel uses its second action to replicate the spell listed for that segment (3rd level, DC 24, spell attack roll +14). This spell’s target is centered on or otherwise includes the nearest creature in the area. This increases the spell’s range to 100 feet if necessary. Any spell cast by this trap is arcane. 1 sleep 2 paralyze 3 lightning bolt (100-foot line) 4 blindness 5 acid arrow 6 ray of enfeeblement
routine.text: On its initiative, the trap uses its first action to spin, then stops. Roll 1d6 to determine which segment is topmost when the wheel stops spinning. Any spell cast by this trap is arcane. 1 sleep 2 paralyze 3 lightning bolt (100-foot line) 4 blindness 5 acid arrow 6 ray of enfeeblement

entries.reset: The trap deactivates and resets if 1 minute passes without any creature moving within range of its sensor. 527 10

entries.name: POISONED DART GALLERY

detection.raw: +16 (expert) or DC 31 (master) to notice the control panel

disable.raw: Thievery DC 21 (expert) on the control panel deactivates the trap.

defenses.raw: 27; Fort +13, Ref +17 14; HP 56 (BT 28) to destroy the control panel and disable the trap; Immunities critical hits, object immunities, precision damage

trigger_actions.raw: Dart Volley [reaction] (attack); Trigger A creature enters the hallway or ends its turn in the hallway. Effect The trap makes a poisoned dart Strike against the triggering creature, then rolls initiative.
trigger_actions.name: Dart Volley
trigger_actions.trigger: A creature enters the hallway or ends its turn in the hallway.
trigger_actions.effect: The trap makes a poisoned dart Strike against the triggering creature, then rolls initiative.

trigger_actions.raw: Continuous Barrage [free-action] Trigger A creature within the active gallery finishes an action. Effect The trap makes a poisoned dart Strike against the triggering creature. Flesset Poison (poison); Saving Throw DC 22 Fortitude; Maximum Duration 6 rounds; Stage 1 1d6 poison damage and clumsy 1 (1 round); Stage 2 2d6 poison damage and clumsy 2 (1 round); Stage 3 3d6 poison damage and clumsy 3 (1 round)
trigger_actions.name: Continuous Barrage
trigger_actions.trigger: A creature within the active gallery finishes an action.
trigger_actions.effect: The trap makes a poisoned dart Strike against the triggering creature. Flesset Poison (poison); Saving Throw DC 22 Fortitude; Maximum Duration 6 rounds; Stage 1 1d6 poison damage and clumsy 1 (1 round); Stage 2 2d6 poison damage and clumsy 2 (1 round); Stage 3 3d6 poison damage and clumsy 3 (1 round)

routine.raw: (1 action) The trap launches one dart against every creature in the gallery as 1 action. Because it launches darts continuously, the trap can also use the Continuous Barrage free action (see below) to launch darts at each creature during that creature’s turn.
routine.text: The trap launches one dart against every creature in the gallery as 1 action. Because it launches darts continuously, the trap can also use the Continuous Barrage free action (see below) to launch darts at each creature during that creature’s turn.

strikes.raw: Ranged poisoned dart +21, Damage 3d4 piercing plus flesset poison; no multiple attack penalty
strikes.name: poisoned dart

entries.reset: The trap deactivates and resets after 1 minute.

raw.disable: Thievery DC 21 (expert) on the control panel deactivates the trap.

entries.name: LAVA FLUME TUBE

disable.raw: Thievery DC 29 (expert) to block a channel, or Thievery DC 31 (master) to release the floor latch and escape to the chamber below

defenses.raw: 30; Fort +20, Ref +16 Channel Hardness 12, Channel HP 48 (BT 24) to destroy a channel gate (this prevents that channel from being disabled and stops the trap from resetting); Floor Hardness 18; Floor HP 72 (BT 36); Immunities critical hits, object immunities, precision damage

trigger_actions.raw: Flume Activation [reaction] Trigger A creature tries to leave the room. Effect The exits seal instantly and the trap rolls initiative.
trigger_actions.name: Flume Activation
trigger_actions.trigger: A creature tries to leave the room.
trigger_actions.effect: The exits seal instantly and the trap rolls initiative.

routine.raw: (4 actions) The trap loses 1 action per disabled channel each turn. On each action, a different channel spews lava, dealing 4d6 fire damage to each creature within 10 feet of the channel (DC 27 basic Reflex save), and increasing the depth of the lava in the room by 1 foot (4 feet per round if all the channels are active). A creature that starts its turn in lava takes 8d6 fire damage and is immobilized until it Escapes the hardening lava (DC 27). The creature might suffocate if covered in lava (page 478). Lava from the previous round hardens fully at the start of the trap’s turn, effectively raising the floor of the room. Once the room is full of lava, the trap stops taking actions, but creatures in the room remain stuck until the floor opens and the trap resets.
routine.text: The trap loses 1 action per disabled channel each turn. On each action, a different channel spews lava, dealing 4d6 fire damage to each creature within 10 feet of the channel (DC 27 basic Reflex save), and increasing the depth of the lava in the room by 1 foot (4 feet per round if all the channels are active). A creature that starts its turn in lava takes 8d6 fire damage and is immobilized until it Escapes the hardening lava (DC 27). The creature might suffocate if covered in lava (page 478). Lava from the previous round hardens fully at the start of the trap’s turn, effectively raising the floor of the room. Once the room is full of lava, the trap stops taking actions, but creatures in the room remain stuck until the floor opens and the trap resets.

entries.reset: The trap deactivates and resets after 1 hour by withdrawing the floor, cracking and dumping the hardened lava (and any creatures trapped inside) into the chamber. Creatures fall 40 feet, taking falling damage (typically 17 bludgeoning damage).

entries.name: TELEKINETIC SWARM TRAP

disable.raw: Thievery DC 27 (expert) to take apart a telekinetic cloud, Thievery DC 32 (master) to disable each telekinetic decoration, or dispel magic (6th level; counteract DC 30) to counteract each telekinetic decoration

defenses.raw: 33; Fort +24, Ref +19 22, HP 88 (BT 44) per telekinetic cloud

trigger_actions.raw: Agitate [reaction] (arcane, evocation); Trigger A creature stays in the room for at least 6 seconds. Effect Each telekinetic decoration constructs a cloud of objects in the room (three clouds total) and the trap rolls initiative. The creatures in the room when the trap is triggered become the trap’s targets, regardless of whether they leave the room or other creatures later enter the room. Each decoration targets a different creature if possible. A target creature that moves at least 1 mile from the trap ceases being a target, at which point the decoration designates a new target.
trigger_actions.name: Agitate
trigger_actions.trigger: A creature stays in the room for at least 6 seconds.
trigger_actions.effect: Each telekinetic decoration constructs a cloud of objects in the room (three clouds total) and the trap rolls initiative. The creatures in the room when the trap is triggered become the trap’s targets, regardless of whether they leave the room or other creatures later enter the room. Each decoration targets a different creature if possible. A target creature that moves at least 1 mile from the trap ceases being a target, at which point the decoration designates a new target.

routine.raw: (9 actions) Each decoration uses 3 of the trap’s actions each turn, and the trap loses 3 actions each turn for every decoration that is disabled. A decoration uses its first action to move its cloud of objects up to 200 feet, its second action to make the objects Strike, and its third action to add more objects to the cloud, increasing its damage by 1d12 (to a maximum of 4d12+10). If a decoration’s cloud is already at maximum damage, it does nothing with its third action. If a decoration’s cloud has been destroyed, the decoration instead spends its first action to create a new cloud of objects inside the room (using the starting damage value) and then its second and third actions to have the cloud move and attack.

If a decoration’s cloud is already at maximum damage, it does nothing with its third action. If a decoration’s cloud has been destroyed, the decoration instead spends its first action to create a new cloud of objects inside the room (using the starting damage value) and then its second and third actions to have the cloud move and attack.

entries.reset: The trap deactivates and resets 10 minutes after it has no target creatures (because the creatures either moved too far away or died).

raw.disable: Thievery DC 27 (expert) to take apart a telekinetic cloud, Thievery DC 32 (master) to disable each telekinetic decoration, or dispel magic (6th level; counteract DC 30) to counteract each telekinetic decoration

Each decoration targets a different creature if possible. A target creature that moves at least 1 mile from the trap ceases being a target, at which point the decoration designates a new target.

entries.name: DARKSIDE MIRROR

detection.raw: +24 (master) to notice it isn’t a regular mirror

disable.raw: Thievery DC 34 (legendary) to retrieve a creature from the other dimension within 10 minutes of the switch 528 (possible only if their mirror duplicate is dead), Thievery DC 39 (master) to permanently disable the mirror once all mirror duplicates are dead, or dispel magic (7th level; counteract DC 32) to counteract the mirror for 1 minute and prevent additional replacements during that time

defenses.raw: 34; Fort +25, Ref +20 1, HP 4 (BT 2), the mirror can’t be damaged while any mirror duplicate is alive

trigger_actions.raw: Reflection of Evil [reaction] (arcane, conjuration, teleportation); Trigger A non-evil creature is reflected in the mirror. Effect The mirror absorbs the creature into the mirror, replacing it with an evil mirror duplicate (DC 34 Reflex to avoid being absorbed into the mirror), and rolls initiative.
trigger_actions.name: Reflection of Evil
trigger_actions.trigger: A non-evil creature is reflected in the mirror.
trigger_actions.effect: The mirror absorbs the creature into the mirror, replacing it with an evil mirror duplicate (DC 34 Reflex to avoid being absorbed into the mirror), and rolls initiative.

routine.raw: (1 action) The mirror absorbs another reflected creature into the mirror and replaces it with a mirror duplicate. Mirror duplicates attack on their own initiative, using the same statistics as the original creature, but with an evil alignment (changing only abilities that shift with the alignment change). A mirror duplicate can spend 3 actions in contact with the mirror to return to its original dimension and release the creature it duplicated, but most mirror duplicates prefer not to.
routine.text: The mirror absorbs another reflected creature into the mirror and replaces it with a mirror duplicate. Mirror duplicates attack on their own initiative, using the same statistics as the original creature, but with an evil alignment (changing only abilities that shift with the alignment change). A mirror duplicate can spend 3 actions in contact with the mirror to return to its original dimension and release the creature it duplicated, but most mirror duplicates prefer not to.

entries.reset: The mirror is always ready to absorb creatures into the other dimension. Ten minutes after a creature is sucked into the mirror, if an ally doesn’t rescue the creature with Thievery, it reaches the other dimension, where it might be captured or killed. In the mirror dimension, it counts as a mirror duplicate, so the denizens of the other dimension can’t destroy the mirror on their side while the absorbed creature is there. These dimensions are alternate realities, not planes, so even rituals like plane shift can’t reach them.

raw.stealth: +24 (master) to notice it isn’t a regular mirror
raw.disable: Thievery DC 34 (legendary) to retrieve a creature from the other dimension within 10 minutes of the switch 528 (possible only if their mirror duplicate is dead), Thievery DC 39 (master) to permanently disable the mirror once all mirror duplicates are dead, or dispel magic (7th level; counteract DC 32) to counteract the mirror for 1 minute and prevent additional replacements during that time
raw.hardness_hp: 1, HP 4 (BT 2), the mirror can’t be damaged while any mirror duplicate is alive
triggered_entries: Reflection of Evil [reaction] (arcane, conjuration, teleportation); Trigger A non-evil creature is reflected in the mirror. Effect The mirror absorbs the creature into the mirror, replacing it with an evil mirror duplicate (DC 34 Reflex to avoid being absorbed into the mirror), and rolls initiative.
raw.routine: (1 action) The mirror absorbs another reflected creature into the mirror and replaces it with a mirror duplicate. Mirror duplicates attack on their own initiative, using the same statistics as the original creature, but with an evil alignment (changing only abilities that shift with the alignment change). A mirror duplicate can spend 3 actions in contact with the mirror to return to its original dimension and release the creature it duplicated, but most mirror duplicates prefer not to.

entries.name: BANSHEE’S SYMPHONY

disable.raw: Thievery DC 42 (master) to pierce the invisible larynx so precisely that the magic releases in a trickle before the trap activates, Thievery DC 44 (legendary) three times to deconstruct the larynx while the trap is active in such a way that it tears the spell apart, or spell DC 38 (9th level) to counteract the wail of the banshee before the trap activates

trigger_actions.raw: Scream [reaction] Trigger Three or more living creatures remain within 100 feet of the trap for 6 seconds or longer. Effect The trap releases an arcane wail of the banshee (DC 40) with a 100-foot-radius emanation instead of 40 feet, targeting all living creatures in the area, and rolls initiative.
trigger_actions.name: Scream
trigger_actions.trigger: Three or more living creatures remain within 100 feet of the trap for 6 seconds or longer.
trigger_actions.effect: The trap releases an arcane wail of the banshee (DC 40) with a 100-foot-radius emanation instead of 40 feet, targeting all living creatures in the area, and rolls initiative.

routine.raw: (1 action) The trap uses its action to force one random creature that failed its save against wail of the banshee last turn to emit a wail of the banshee with the same statistics as the initial one. The creature wails even if it is dead or unable to speak, no matter how far away from the trap it is. Unlike a casting of the spell, the drained condition from this trap’s wail of the banshee spells increases the targets’ drained condition values. A creature that critically succeeds at any of its saves can still be affected by the trap on future rounds, but can’t be forced to wail by the trap.
routine.text: The trap uses its action to force one random creature that failed its save against wail of the banshee last turn to emit a wail of the banshee with the same statistics as the initial one. The creature wails even if it is dead or unable to speak, no matter how far away from the trap it is. Unlike a casting of the spell, the drained condition from this trap’s wail of the banshee spells increases the targets’ drained condition values. A creature that critically succeeds at any of its saves can still be affected by the trap on future rounds, but can’t be forced to wail by the trap.

entries.reset: The trap ends when the trap is unable to make a creature scream (usually because no creature failed its save on the previous turn or because all creatures have critically succeeded in the past). It then resets over 24 hours, as a new scream builds up in the mummified larynx. 529 10 530

raw.disable: Thievery DC 42 (master) to pierce the invisible larynx so precisely that the magic releases in a trickle before the trap activates, Thievery DC 44 (legendary) three times to deconstruct the larynx while the trap is active in such a way that it tears the spell apart, or spell DC 38 (9th level) to counteract the wail of the banshee before the trap activates

Unlike a casting of the spell, the drained condition from this trap’s wail of the banshee spells increases the targets’ drained condition values. A creature that critically succeeds at any of its saves can still be affected by the trap on future rounds, but can’t be forced to wail by the trap.
